definitions.definition: a type of solid mineral substance that is usually hard and shiny and that heat and electricity can travel through, for example tin, iron and gold

examples.text: The frame is made of metal.
Sheet metal was chosen for the exterior walls and roof.
Factory waste containing heavy metals could cause pollution.
The bomb left a pile of jagged glass and twisted metal.
a sculptor who works in metal
the sound of metal clanging against metal
the sudden pressure of cold metal against her cheek
The company makes equipment to recycle scrap metal.
Twisted hunks of metal were falling off the facade.

definitions.definition: (to go) at full speed; (to drive) with the accelerator of the car pressed to the floor

examples.text: We drove through the night flat-out, with the pedal to the metal.

definitions.definition: to use as much effort as possible; with as much effort as possible

examples.text: I'm still putting the pedal to the metal here at work.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French metal or Latin metallum, from Greek metallon ‘mine, quarry, or metal’.
